title: About Me
text: I am Mao Yang, a first-year Master of Science (ScM) student in the Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology at Johns Hopkins University. Originally from southwestern China, I bring a unique perspective to my research in cancer biology and aging.

title: About Me
text: I am Mao Yang, a first-year Master of Science (ScM) student in the Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology at Johns Hopkins University. Originally from southwestern China, I bring a unique perspective to my research in cancer biology and aging.

title: About Me
text:
Professional Interests
My research focuses on understanding the molecular mechanisms underlying therapy resistance in cancer cells, with a particular emphasis on how aging processes contribute to this phenomenon. I am passionate about:

Cancer Biology: Investigating how cancer cells develop resistance to therapeutic interventions
Aging Research: Understanding the intersection between aging and cancer progression
Molecular Mechanisms: Exploring cellular pathways that contribute to disease progression
Translational Research: Bridging the gap between basic science and clinical applications

title: About Me
text:
My Philosophy
I believe that scientific research is not just about discovering new knowledge, but about making a meaningful impact on human health and well-being. Through my work in cancer biology, I hope to contribute to the development of more effective therapeutic strategies that can improve patient outcomes.

‚ÄúScience is not only a disciple of reason but, also, one of romance and passion.‚Äù - Stephen Hawking
